items.todoItem: Know that God has made you alive who were once spiritually dead in trespasses and sins.
Know that in the past, not only did you sin but you sinned willfully.
Know that your former life was influenced and guided by the standards of this world.
Know that Satan is the one behind the standards of this world.
Know that Satan is currently the ruler of this world.
Know that Satan is the spirit now working in the children of disobedience.
Know that we were all once children of disobedience living to fulfil the desires of the flesh and of the mind.
Know that we were each born with a sinful, fallen nature.
Know that in the past it was our nature to live just like others who are worthy of the wrath of God.
Know that God is rich in mercy.
Know that God’s love for us is great.
Know that God demonstrated His great love for us even when we were spiritually dead in sins.
Know that God has made us alive together with Christ.
Know that we are saved by grace.
Know that we were raised by God from the dead together with Christ.
Know that God has reserved a place for us in heaven in Christ and sees us seated together with Christ.
Know that in future ages God will show the immense and incomparable riches of His grace in His kindness toward us through Christ Jesus.
Know that by God’s grace you are saved by faith.
Know that your faith is not your own: it is the gift of God.
Know that our salvation was not earned by any good works that we have done.
Know that salvation can never be earned through good works so no man could ever boast of such.
Know that there is nothing that we can do to make God love us any more or less than He already does!
Know that we are the work of God’s own hands.
Know that we were created in Christ Jesus for good works that God preordained us to perform.
Know that our redemption gives us godly purpose for good works.
Take comfort in knowing that God has a unique plan for His good works in your life.
Remember that in the past you were a Gentile and lived according to the lusts of the flesh.
Remember that in the past as a Gentile in the flesh you were called Uncircumcision by the Jews.
Remember that once you were without Christ.
Remember that once you were alienated from the commonwealth of Israel.
Remember that once you were a stranger from the covenants of promise.
Remember that once you were without hope.
Remember that once you were far from and without God in the world.
Know that you, who were once far from God, are brought near to God by the blood of Christ.
Know that you no longer live according to the ways of this world.
Know that Jesus is our peace.
Know that in Christ Jews and Gentiles both become one.
Know that Jesus has destroyed all barriers that once separated Jews and Gentiles.
Know that the crucified flesh of Jesus has abolished all hatred between Jews and Gentiles in Christ.
Know that the crucified flesh of Jesus has abolished the Jewish ceremonial law.
Know that in Christ Jews and Gentiles are both made into the same new creation thereby making peace.
Know that what you are now in Christ is in direct contrast to what you used to be when you were far from God.
Know that Jesus has reconciled both Jews and Gentiles to God in His body by the cross.
Know that Jesus has ended the hatred between Jews and Gentiles in His body by the cross.
Know that Jesus came and proclaimed peace to both Gentiles and Jews.
Know that in Christ both Jews and Gentiles have access to the Father by the same Holy Spirit.
Know that in Christ Gentiles are no longer strangers to the covenants of promise.
Know that in Christ Gentiles are no longer foreigners alienated from the commonwealth of Israel.
Know that in Christ both Jews and Gentiles are fellow citizens with the saints and of the household of God.
Know that you and your faith are built upon the firm foundation laid by the apostles and prophets because Jesus Himself is the chief corner stone.
Know that you were uniquely crafted in Christ to fit precisely into the growing building which is the Lord’s holy temple.
Know that Jews and Gentiles are being built together in Christ for the habitation of God through the Holy Spirit.
Know that God’s Holy Spirit dwells within you.
